column1: One of the scariest facts we’ve learned in @SelectGOP is that mammograms are down 87% due to COVID.   That is hundreds of thousands of lives at risk due to lost access to medical services which means the fight against breast cancer is as serious as ever.  https://t.co/vCD7ZHCg6w

What’s the difference in this version of House Democrats' COVID relief bill and the last partisan bill they floated? This one has $600 million less for law enforcement.   That’s not compromise that's defunding the police. https://t.co/tjFpjVr5hS

Great news for MO ag producers! @USDA is now providing additional direct assistance to farmers and ranchers whose operations have been affected by COVID-19.   For more information and how to apply please visit: https://t.co/wVLNdk199V
Yesterday I joined @AftertheBell discuss the prospects of another COVID-19 relief package following the @SelectGOP hearing with Treasury Secretary Mnuchin.  https://t.co/k0LTB5fLEC

I have been & will continue to be a supporter of #USPS in Congress.   But Democrats are crying wolf over a manufactured crisis to distract from the fact that they refused to work with Republicans and @realDonaldTrump on further COVID-19 relief for America. https://t.co/zc3vn71QxO

I've become increasingly concerned about hospitals’ inflated COVID-19 fatality reporting during my time on @SelectGOP.   Now more than ever we need to be able to trust the numbers our medical officials are telling us.  https://t.co/stxhQErkrl

There are plans to be flexible and to continue to address issues as they pop up. As we go through and have schools open up I think we can manage COVID-19. We just have to learn how to do that. https://t.co/kmtIfZEowo

ICYMI: Yesterday I joined @tperkins on “Washington Watch” to discuss the issue of hospitals reporting unrelated fatalities as COVID-19 deaths to receive more funding.    Highlights and full interview here: https://t.co/JYocKa9AHo

I'm calling on @CDCgov & @HHSGov to address COVID-19 death misreporting in hospitals.  The 20% additional reimbursement for COVID-related deaths may have created a perverse incentive to over-code COVID-19 deaths even if it wasn't the ultimate cause. https://t.co/mm8M4N2Hic

.@CDCgov Director and @HHSGov Assist. Secretary for Health have now both confirmed in @SelectGOP that hospitals in some states have been reporting unrelated fatalities as COVID-19 deaths to receive more funding.   This irresponsible and unethical practice cannot continue. https://t.co/zqzPxcFKH2

COVID-19 has created a real-life case study of CECL’s procyclicality & has shown it wreaks havoc in a downturn. This harmful accounting standard is bad for institutions investors & everyday Americans.   It’s time we eliminate #CECL once and for all. https://t.co/wCtNdcyf25
Don’t forget to join me TONIGHT for a tele-town hall on the coronavirus.   Please sign up by noon today to join our call list: https://t.co/63PovFC9s0

Please join me this THURSDAY at 4:50 pm for a tele-town hall to discuss the coronavirus and what Congress is doing to help Missourians.   To sign up for our call list please visit: https://t.co/sitK7fzeTG

.@realDonaldTrump took decisive action to protect our country by restricting travel from China to slow the spread of COVID-19. Today House Dems voted to undermine POTUS' ability to secure our borders and keep us safe.   These political games are putting American lives in danger.
Today HHS Assistant Secretary for Health confirmed states are inflating COVID-19 fatality numbers to receive higher payments. https://t.co/W8g3iXsMbQ

.@COVIDOversight Dems are feigning concern over the loan process they themselves helped design in the CARES Act.   Their demand for the personal & financial info of millions of Americans is an attempt to shame small biz owners & attack the Administration. https://t.co/vpyxdXLP0k

We are all too well aware of the toll the coronavirus crisis has taken on our country but it has been more than just physically. The economic fallout from this pandemic has put the mental health of Americans across the nation at risk. https://t.co/fBJnIikRfS

For Missouri farmers ranchers and ag producers whose operations have been impacted by COVID-19 @USDA will begin accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance program on May 26.   More details and instructions can be found here: https://t.co/u2SfJf4EHq

From the largest cities in America to the smallest town in Missouri everyone has been affected by the economic fallout caused by the COVID-19 crisis. The modernization of the CRA is a perfect reminder of the need for banks to reinvest in their communities.https://t.co/YXKZpAMerp

Not only did China cause a global pandemic they manipulated the WHO to help them cover it up.   Yesterday @SelectGOP & I sent a letter asking Democrats to help us hold China accountable for the COVID-19 outbreak & the WHO for not doing its job. https://t.co/ilHLphJPFR

Today House Democrats voted to pass a self-titled "liberal wish list" disguised as a COVID-19 relief package & a rule change allowing them to no longer travel to Washington DC to pass laws. America needs leadership from Congress right now – this isn’t it.https://t.co/82AwINExpV

MO farmers ranchers & ag producers who would like to apply for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) can learn about the application process & necessary documentation in a webinar hosted by @USDA tomorrow May 14 at noon CT.   Register here: https://t.co/VNkiEgvEOf

The coronavirus pandemic has put Missouri through a trying few months and our faith remains as important as ever.   Today on National Day of Prayer we pray for the families who have been affected by the virus and for the healing of our country. https://t.co/Qf4N7TqG03

TUNE IN tonight at 8:00pm for a live virtual town hall with the entire Missouri Congressional delegation. I’m looking forward to answering questions about coronavirus and addressing its effects on the Third District. https://t.co/ynxXo7fzYj

Instead of holding China accountable for its role in this pandemic Democrats are using Congress' time & resources for yet another witch hunt & attack on @realDonaldTrump. I look forward serving on the Coronavirus Oversight Committee to hold my Democratic colleagues accountable. https://t.co/5jsLvMVDHM

Nurses have gone above and beyond the call of duty to get Missouri safely through the COVID-19 crisis and have risked their own health on the frontlines caring for others. On this #NationalNursesDay we cannot thank you enough for everything you do. https://t.co/HpflI9gL4N

Don’t forget! I’ll be doing a tele-town hall TOMORROW at 5:00pm to give an update on coronavirus and take your questions.   To be added to our call list please sign up here by noon tomorrow: https://t.co/sitK7fQQig

While the last few months have been trying as we've stayed home to slow the spread of COVID-19  MO is on the path to safely reopening. PPP is back up & running testing has become more available & we're getting closer & closer to a safe return to normal.https://t.co/x1uk8mAy7l

Please join me this TUESDAY May 5th at 5:00pm for another tele-town hall on the coronavirus. Looking forward to hearing from the Third District and answering your questions.   To sign up for our call list please click here: https://t.co/sitK7fzeTG

MO businesses like our favorite restaurants barber shops & florists have been devastated by COVID-19's economic impact & need help weathering this storm. Congress has passed a bill to provide more funding to the PPP & our incredible medical community. https://t.co/GrSDXTMJTf

For Missourians who don’t file annual tax returns it may be necessary to provide the IRS with more information in order to receive your COVID-19 Economic Impact Payment. More information here:  https://t.co/mQK1qIkK3P

Please join me TOMORROW at 4:10pm for a tele-town hall on the coronavirus where I’ll be providing an update and taking your questions. To be added to our call list please sign up here by noon tomorrow: https://t.co/sitK7fQQig

Please join me this coming TUESDAY April 14th at 4:10pm for a tele-town hall on the coronavirus. I’m looking forward to updating the Third District and taking your questions about the virus & the government’s response. Sign up to participate here: https://t.co/sitK7fQQig

Missouri doctors nurses and health care workers are on the frontlines of the COVID-19 crisis risking their lives to help all of us. On this #WorldHealthDay please take a moment to thank these heroes. https://t.co/WSo48STzSM

Many MO children rely on free/reduced meals at school. Classes have been cancelled due to COVID-19 but the majority of 3rd District schools are still providing meals for students who need them. More info on participating schools and operating hours here:  https://t.co/wOp4ogYGtJ

Due to the critical role ag producers play in our state's food supply chain MO farmers have been deemed “essential” by @DHS & @GovParsonMO  while we deal with #COVID19. Important documents for farmers to continue working uninterrupted can be found here: https://t.co/BIvvujZ9Kv

On Friday federal regulators announced a 2-year delay in capital requirements under #CECL. COVID-19 has created a real-life case study of #CECL's procyclicality & exacerbation of stress on financial institutions’ balance sheets that cannot be ignored. https://t.co/HZ8BjWIuWQ

The spread of #COVID19 has created an unprecedented situation in MO & our state/local governments need additional help to get Missourians through a health crisis of this magnitude. Thankful @realDonaldTrump has approved a major disaster declaration for MO. https://t.co/Av8xQasB3P

The deadline for REAL ID enforcement has been extended nationwide by @DHS to October 1 2021. This is a big help for Missourians who haven’t been able to get a new ID due to the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/306SISQVcN

Today the MO congressional delegation sent a letter supporting @GovParsonMO’s request for a federal emergency disaster declaration for Missouri to give our hospitals schools businesses & families the resources they need to respond to #COVID19.   https://t.co/QAWfyB3CaK

The Small Business Administration (SBA) will be hosting a webinar for small business owners affected by #COVID19 with SBA Administrator Jovita Carranza this Friday March 27th at 1:00pm CT. Register here: https://t.co/4PSfj0Qmbz

Along with the @USTreasury moving tax day to July 15 this year due to the spread of #COVID19 @MissouriRevenue has extended the Missouri tax filing deadline to July 15 and expiring drivers licenses and vehicle registrations have been granted extensions. https://t.co/BuEkebX2j3

As MO responds to the spread of #COVID19 or coronavirus resources are available to ensure your families & businesses stay as safe & prepared as possible. Please visit my coronavirus information page for the latest updates and support resources. https://t.co/u09ex9BQul

Missouri small business owners who have been impacted by the spread of #COVID19 are NOW eligible for disaster loan assistance through the Small Business Administration (SBA). Apply for a loan here: https://t.co/waT18BaAfq https://t.co/ckGXYEHiuw

Today I led a letter to Congressional leadership requesting the inclusion of a CECL delay in the third coronavirus funding package. It’s clear CECL poses a significant threat to exacerbate the current economic instability. https://t.co/k0n6xGMnDt

ATTENTION #MO03 Small Business Owners! @realDonaldTrump will be hosting a conference call regarding #COVID19 with small business owners nationwide TODAY at 2:45pm CT. You'll receive call in information once you have registered with the following link: https://t.co/utV9ss7phX
All Missouri Schools have been closed due to #COVID19. @MOEducation will provide updates on reopening when available.  https://t.co/MdfmoPFjK4

If you are a small business owner in #MO03 and need information on how to connect with your local Small Business Association (SBA) partner for assistance while our state continues to deal with the spread of  #COVID19 please click here: https://t.co/awX6pvf7BY https://t.co/ckGXYEYTm4

If you or someone in your family is not feeling well and would like to have your symptoms addressed by a health care provider from home @muhealth is offering free video visits to assess for coronavirus. https://t.co/D4Il01pClN

Small businesses are the heart & soul of MO. In the coming weeks they could struggle to stay open as the U.S. responds to #COVID19. Yesterday the MO congressional delegation sent a letter supporting  @GovParsonMO's request for small business assistance. https://t.co/m9C8GgngAv
We learned this evening that an individual in Cole County has tested positive for coronavirus.   https://t.co/T8A00mXP3q

While our state deals with #COVID19 @MOChamber is offering webinars resources and daily updates to help prepare and secure Missouri businesses and employers. Please find more information here: https://t.co/7RZZ30vWDQ
@HealthyLivingMo continues to provide updated information on the #COVID19 response. For guidance visit their website or call the hotline at 877-435-8411.   https://t.co/p5dIf6mWk1
If you or someone you know is looking for guidance on COVID-19 (coronavirus) @HealthyLivingMo now has a hotline where you can talk to medical professionals. https://t.co/D2sVgkkRFm

Please remember to be vigilant not only about your health but people trying to take advantage of this situation. To report coronavirus-related phishing scams or price gauging call @AGEricSchmitt's Consumer Protection Hotline at 1-800-392-8222. https://t.co/xBgJ7eXoOX

Earlier today @realDonaldTrump signed the Congress-passed coronavirus funding bill into law. It'll increase diagnostic test availability support treatment & fund vaccine development. Guidelines for staying healthy can be found at https://t.co/lqVmGitkpW https://t.co/251FJIT23D
